newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Cultus says analysis results encouraging.
newsitem.headline: Cultus says analysis results encouraging.

text.p: Cultus Petroleum NL, through its wholly-owned subsidiary Basin Oil NZ, said on Thursday a preliminary core analysis undertaken in the WA-241-P joint venture had produced highly encouraging results.
The analysis, performed on behalf of operator Shell Australia (Development) Pty, was carried out on the 11 full hole cores cut from 778.0 mRT to 861.3 mRT in Cornea 2ST1.

"The results indicate that of the three prospective reservoir sections the upper two sections B and C have typical permeabilities of 218 and 285 millidarcies respectively and porosites of 30.5 and 34.6 percent," Cultus said.
"The lower E unit has a permeability range of 300 to 2,350 millidarcies and a porosity of 32.5 percent.
"These results are highly encouraging and indicate that the reservoirs are producible," Cultus said.

It said the joint venture is preparing to enter a new seismic acquisition and exploration/appraisal drilling program for the permit WA-241-P, and also in the recently offered, adjacent gazettal blocks WA96-4 and WA96-5.
